name: Volley
long_description:
Volley builds the best voice AI games and entertainment experiences for Amazon Alexa, smartphones, and TVs.

Popular Volley voice games include “Song Quiz”, “Jeopardy!”, and “The Price Is Right”.

Our voice apps are used by millions of people every month. We believe voice control will become the main way people access entertainment in their bedrooms, kitchens, living rooms, and cars, and our goal is to become the "Netflix of Voice" for this emerging category of devices.

Volley was founded by Max Child and James Wilsterman in 2016. We're a hybrid remote/in-person company, headquartered in San Francisco.
one_liner: Voice AI games on smart speakers, TVs, and mobile

name: BoldVoice
long_description: BoldVoice helps non-native English speakers to speak clearly and confidently. We combine bite-sized video lessons from Hollywood accent coaches with instant pronunciation feedback from AI, to create an effective and engaging learning experience.
one_liner: Speech and accent coaching app for non-native English speakers

name: Speechly
long_description:
Speechly makes it cost efficient to understand human conversations, in real-time. We do this by enabling high-accuracy spoken language understanding processed right on the end user’s device.

Hundreds of millions of hours of audio data are generated every single day online. Speechly is the first solution that can affordably turn this audio into actionable insights.
one_liner: Natural Language Understanding API for Speech that runs on device

name: Uplift AI
long_description:
We build speech understanding and speech generation models for regional languages, and make them available through easy to use APIs and SDKs.

A billion people can't read any language. Additionally, in most languages typing is really hard/slow. As a result, text-interfaces (apps and websites) haven't worked in emerging markets and most work have remained offline. This is causing economies billions of dollars in lost worker efficiency.

Voice AI can fix this, and onboard 100s of millions of new users on to digital services -- for the first time. 

But current Voice Models suck... After the top 5 languages, the models are so bad you can't make any Voice product on top of them. We are fixing this by creating state of the art models for regional languages. 

We are able to do this coz we created unique data gathering and labeling methods to solve for small languages. We already have SOTA models in multiple languages (like Balochi, Sindhi).

We are on a mission to uplift entire nations by giving everyone access to digital information and digital services. 

Team:
Our team has previously created Voice technology used by millions daily. We worked on Alexa and Siri; And have launched entire AWS services like AWS Bedrock Guardrails.
 
We do in-house research and development. We gather our own data, then train and deploy our own models. We own our technology stack end-to-end.
one_liner: Foundational Voice Models for regional languages

name: Blue
long_description:
Blue is the only voice assistant on iOS and Android that can control every app on your phone, so you can get work done hands-free.

It reads and replies to messages and email across apps, attaches photos and files, books and pays, manages calendar items, and more.

Unlike assistants that stop at answers or timers, Blue taps, types, and swipes inside your existing apps with no app-specific integrations. On iPhone, a tiny USB-C plug-in (“Bud”) provides precise input control so Blue can act on your behalf. (Android support is in testing.)

Blue is already in real-world use: people are clearing inboxes, paying bills from email, sharing files, and moving through routine flows while their hands are busy.

The team brings complementary experience at scale: Omar Abdelaziz led Google Assistant’s transition to LLMs and holds one of earliest patents in LLM-based computer control; Peter Krogh spent decades designing voice-first dialog systems and was most recently a design lead at Google DeepMind building actions for Gemini Live; Muhammad Farhan Hossain helped ship Apple Vision Pro, is named on dozens of hardware/systems patents, and has led products from prototype to mass production.

We’ve built systems used by billions. Now we’re on to defining the next era of computing.
one_liner: The only voice assistant that can control every app on your phone.
